[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Path Traversal] Can an attacker provide a malicious path containing '..' sequences that bypasses the parent() extraction logic, allowing them to access files outside the intended configuration directory and potentially read validator private keys or consensus state? (Critical)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Path Canonicalization] Is the path canonicalized before extracting the parent directory, or can attackers exploit non-canonical paths (e.g., '/path/./config/../../../etc/passwd') to escape the root directory restriction? (High)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Empty Path Handling] When path.parent() returns None, the code defaults to empty string PathBuf - can this cause security issues where config files are loaded from the current working directory instead of a secure location? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Race Condition] Is there a TOCTOU vulnerability between when the parent path is extracted and when it's later used in full_path(), allowing an attacker to replace the directory with a symlink to a malicious location? (High)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Absolute Path Bypass] Can an attacker provide an absolute path that has no parent (e.g., '/'), causing the parent() to return None and defaulting to empty string, potentially loading configs from an attacker-controlled current directory? (High)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Windows Path Traversal] On Windows systems, does this properly handle UNC paths (\\\\server\\share) or drive-relative paths (C:file.txt without slash), which could bypass parent directory extraction? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Null Byte Injection] Can an attacker inject null bytes in the path string to truncate the path at a different location, bypassing parent directory validation? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Unicode Normalization] Are Unicode paths normalized before processing, or can attackers use homograph attacks with lookalike Unicode characters to bypass path validation checks? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new()] [Concurrent Modification] If multiple threads call RootPath::new() with the same path simultaneously while the filesystem is being modified, can race conditions lead to inconsistent root_path values across validator instances causing consensus divergence? [File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new_path()] [Directory Assumption Violation] The function assumes the path is already a directory without validation - can an attacker provide a file path that gets treated as a directory, causing security issues when configs are loaded relative to a file instead of its parent? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new_path()] [Symbolic Link Following] Does new_path() follow symbolic links without validation, allowing an attacker to point the root directory to /tmp or other world-writable locations where they can inject malicious config files? [File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new_path()] [Non-Existent Path] Can this function accept non-existent paths without validation, causing validators to load configs from unintended locations or fail silently, leading to nodes running with default (potentially insecure) configurations? [File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new_path()] [Relative Path Confusion] If a relative path is provided to new_path(), it gets stored as-is - can this cause different validators to resolve to different absolute paths based on their current working directory, leading to configuration divergence and consensus failures? [File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::new_path()] [Cross-Platform Inconsistency] Are paths handled consistently across Linux/Windows/macOS, or can platform-specific path separators (\\, /) cause validators on different OS to load different config files, breaking consensus determinism? (High)

[File: config/src/config/utils.rs] [Function: RootPath::full_path()] [Empty Path Handling] What happens if file_path is empty - does join() produce unexpected results that could load default or fallback configs from unintended locations? (Low)
